p: Despite abundant evidence on the beneficial activity of omega-3 fatty acids on human health, including cardiovascular diseases, there are also some concerns regarding the safety of their administration. The main concern is related to the possibility of an increased bleeding risk as a result of omega-3s supplementation. According to Bays [ 145], the involvement of omega-3s in eicosanoid metabolism may be the biochemical cause of possible increased bleeding in the case of increased omega-3 fatty intake. The author points out, that although there is little evidence for an increased risk for clinically significant bleeding incidence with omega-3 fatty acid supplementation, this should be taken into account.
